text: Neri Valen (26 September 1893 - 4 January 1954) was a Norwegian politician for the Liberal Party. He was born in Bø. He was elected to the Norwegian Parliament from Telemark in 1931, and was re-elected on four occasions. Shortly into his fifth term, he died and was replaced by Ketil Skogen. Valen became a member of Bø municipality in 1919, and became mayor in 1922. From 1925 to 1931 he served as deputy mayor. During the occupation of Norway by Nazi Germany he was imprisoned in Grini concentration camp from 24 November 1943, then in Berg concentration camp from 20 March 1944 to the occupation's end in May 1945. ==References== Category:1893 births Category:1963 deaths Category:Liberal Party (Norway) politicians Category:Members of the Storting Category:Mayors of places in Telemark Category:Norwegian resistance members Category:Grini concentration camp survivors Category:Berg concentration camp survivors Category:20th-century Norwegian politicians
title: Neri Valen
